author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are uppercase.
- Name is not at least five characters long
- Package name similar to 17 existing packages.
<details>
<summary>Similar package names</summary>

1. Similar to DSP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
2. Similar to GCP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
3. Similar to MD5. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
4. Similar to MKL. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
5. Similar to GAP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
6. Similar to ITK. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
7. Similar to MPI. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
8. Similar to Mux. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
9. Similar to MAT. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
10. Similar to MLJ. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
11. Similar to HTTP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
12. Similar to GMT. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
13. Similar to MCTS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
14. Similar to MMTF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
15. Similar to Tk. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
16. Similar to UMAP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
17. Similar to QMDP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
</details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

After you have fixed the AutoMerge issues, simple retrigger Registrator, which will automatically update this pull request. You do not need to change the version number in your `Project.toml` file (unless of course the AutoMerge issue is that you skipped a version number, in which case you should change the version number).

If you do not want to fix the AutoMerge issues, please post a comment explaining why you would like this pull request to be manually merged.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->

I'll rename to follow the naming conventions.
Please close this request.

Is there a way to check for similar names before submitting the request?

> Is there a way to check for similar names before submitting the request?

CC @ericphanson

Yeah, there is a way to do that, it’s written on https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/1f5e256ce4823c8466df053f3090bee1561b0095/README.md#automatic-merging-of-pull-requests under the bullet point starting with “To prevent confusion...” (you have to scroll down a bit)

body:
- Registering package: MTP
- Repository: https://github.com/tp2750/MTP.jl
- Created by: @tp2750
- Version: v0.1.0
- Commit: 7bff01fa3f23e57f59c6d596592721ee48379a63
- Git reference: v0.1.0
- Release notes:
<!-- BEGIN RELEASE NOTES -->
> With this initial release of MPT.jl you can easily
> 
> *    Generate a DataFrame representing a micro plate with `MTP.plate()`
>  *   Parse an xlsx file describing the contents of wells on a micro plate with `MTP.platesetupfile()`
> 
<!-- END RELEASE NOTES -->
title: New package: MTP v0.1.0
